description: From Middle English plodder, equivalent to plod +‎ -er.

examples: Brown rats, black rats, grey rats, tawny rats,
Grave old plodders, gay young friskers  […]

entries.meaning: A person who works slowly, making a great effort with little result; a person who studies laboriously.
examples: What an indefatigable plodder you are to get those papers ready so soon, and an unmerciful man besides to make me go over them to-night.
